title: Marketing and Advertising Manager
description: Marketing and Advertising Manager Security Clearance Expo Privately Held; 11-50 employees; Staffing and Recruiting industry June 2011 – Present (1 year 1 month) SecurityClearanceEXPO.com host the most exclusive recruiting events for the intelligence & defense community for professionals with a active Security Clearance. As the preferred vendor of nearly every government contractor over the last 10 years with a client retention rate of over 95%. SecurityClearanceEXPO.com 2012 May 24th Virginia/DC - Happy Hour Hiring event 4PM – 8PM June 7th -Linthicum, MD – 12PM - 4 PM July 12th – Arlington, VA – 10AM - 3PM July 26th- Ft Hachuca - 10AM - 2PM August 2nd - Linthicum, MD – – 3PM - 7PM Evening Job Fair August 8th - Tyson’s Corner, VA – 10AM - 3PM September 12th Linthicum, MD Happy Hour Hiring event 4PM – 8PM October 4th - Linthicum, MD – 12PM-5PM October 25th– Arlington, VA – 10AM - 3PM December 6th - Linthicum, MD – – 3PM - 7PM Evening Events December 13th - Tyson’s Corner, VA – 10AM - 3PM EMPLOYERS: Contact me at Josh@SecurityClearanceEXPO.com for details on maximizing your exposure at and before our events. If you like to be a part of all the success at SecurityClearanceEXPO.com contact Anthony@SecurityClearanceEXPO.com or call 516-972-7579 x 260 Remember We Are The Official SecurityClearanceEXPO!
name: Joshua Dalgo

title: Deputy Director for Congressional Affairs
description: Deputy Director for Congressional Affairs to Commander, International Security Assistance Force - Afghanistan (COMISAF). Develops and executes the legislative strategy for the Commander for all interaction with Members of Congress to support Office Secretary of Defense, Office of Chairman Joint Chiefs of Staff, US Central Command and COMISAF's agendas before Congress. Special advisor to the ISAF Commander on all Congressional matters and related strategic regional issues associated with Afghan National Security Forces, ISAF and USFOR-A. Assists in preparation of and provides advice to COMISAF, senior command leadership and senior staff officers for Congressional briefings, meetings and other engagements. Coordinates with Members of Congress and their staff, senior OSD staff, senior joint staff officers, senior U.S. Embassy Kabul staff, USCENTCOM, ISAF, USFOR-A, IJC and Regional Command senior staff to schedule, develop and execute House/Senate Appropriations Subcommittees on Defense & Foreign Operations/State; House/Senate Armed Services; House Foreign Affairs Committee (HFAC); Senate Foreign Relations Committee (SFRC); House Oversight & Government Reform (HOGRC); House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence (HPSCI); and the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence (SSCI) Congressional members and staff oversight delegation visits to Afghanistan.
name: Ray Windmiller

title: Legislative Liaison, House Liaison Division, Office of the Chief Legislative Liaison, US Army
company: Legislative Liaison, House Liaison Division, Office of the Chief Legislative Liaison, US Army
description: Primary Military Staff Analyst responsible to support the interests of 62 Members of Congress from the states of California, Nevada, Hawaii, Guam and Northern Mariana Islands. Primary responsibilities (to the US Army) in this role consist of outreach and assisting Members with constituent inquiries and informational briefings on Army programs and policy issues in order to educate Member’s and staff. • Assumed Acting Deputy Chief, House Liaison Division for 5 months, ensuring that Army outreach events were planned and executed and provided Army Senior Leaders the opportunity to engage with Members of Congress and Staff. • Deployed and developed a first-of-its-kind SharePoint site on the Secretary of the Army Portal to synchronize and facilitate support between the Army House Liaison Division as well as the larger organization of Office of Chief Legislative Liaison. • Facilitated Congressional activities relative to engagements between the Army and Members of Congress. • Planned, coordinated and executed Congressional Delegation to Representative Bill Young’s funeral; the delegation included all leadership of the House of Representatives and was attended by 27 Members of Congress. • Coordinated and executed three overseas CODELs with 17 Members of Congress to Austria, Libya, Lebanon, Israel, Egypt, Russia, Norway, Netherlands, England, Mexico, Guatemala, and Haiti; partnered with the Department of State and host country government officials to develop the itinerary.
name: Ray Windmiller

title: Legislative Affairs, G-3/5/7
description: Member of a three person team to represent, advise and support the legislative interface for the G-3/5/7 for the Army encompassing an organization consisting of nine Directorates (Army Senior Leaders), sixty plus Divisions, and over 240 Branches as Subject Matter Expert supporting over 2000 members of G-3/5/7. • Supported two G-3/5/7 Lieutenant General’s and advised in most prudent manner to address Congressional, Department of Defense, and White House related issues. • Completed, addressed, and prepared over 300 Questions for the Record (QFRs), prepared numerous General Officers for Congressional Testimony, and supported daily Request for Information relative to Congressional interest and responsibilities concerning the Army. • Led preparation for all Congressional hearings, including Army Senior Leader posture hearings to Senate and House Armed Services Committees- Lieutenant General Huggins stated he was “the most prepared ever he was.” • Guided staff in the development of key relationships with Congressional personal and committee professional staff, Congressional caucuses (Readiness, Cyber Operations), business associations, and lobbyists in order to provide the Army G-3/5/7 a holistic view of issues involving the Army’s equities.

title: Defense Legislative Fellow at U.S. Representative Jim Cooper (TN-05) at U.S. Army
description: Member of Congressman James Cooper’s personal legislative staff performing primary function of military Subject Matter Expert supporting the Congressman and his functions as a member of: House Armed Services Committee, House Armed Services sub-committee Tactical Air and Land, and Oversight and Investigations. Worked with Professional Staff Members to educate the Congressman on Legislative legislation, vote recommendations and hearing preparation. • Supported the House Armed Services Committee crafting legislation relative to the Congressman’s requirements; drafted critical bill and report language for inclusion in the annual National Defense Authorization Act. • Primary Military Advisor to the Congressman on a wide range of issues including Defense, Veterans Affairs, Military Construction, and Trade. • Facilitated the Congressman’s numerous speaking engagements preparing supportive briefs, speeches and talking points ensuring consistency with his positions on those legislative issues. • Expertly led collaboration between Congressional staff, Department of Defense representatives, and the Department of Veteran Affairs relative to issues of importance within his Congressional district or specifically requested by members of his constituency. .

title: Company Commander
company: D CO 4-31 IN Fort Drum, NY
description: Chief Executive Officer -Commanded a U.S. Army Infantry Company consisting of 87 Infantry soldiers and $8 Million worth of equipment in both combat (IRAQ) as well as home station duties at Fort Drum, NY. • Successfully prepared and deployed the Company to the combat theater and back to NY; initiated programs to assist in the recovery and structured build up of resiliency necessary to succeed in a second deployment in less than two years. • Partnered and mentored an Iraqi Army Battalion in Iraq 2009-2010 preparing for their ensuing mission for following the planned U.S. forces departure. • Established and supported the necessary Family Support Network critical for family members while their loved ones were deployed. • Maintained 100% Accountability of all assigned and issued equipment at home station and in combat ensuring that all tenets of the Battalion’s Command Supply Discipline Program were adhered to.
name: Ray Windmiller

title: Battalion Executive Officer
description: Chief of Operations - Senior staff lead and second in command of an Infantry Training Battalion assigned to the 197th Infantry Brigade. Responsible for synchronization of all staff activities of the Battalion: Personnel, Supply, and Maintenance for 75 assigned vehicles and over $4 million dollars of equipment. • Maintained the battalions combat equipment at a 97% readiness rate and provided 100% of logistical support requirments • Planned, forecasted, and executed a maintenance program budgeted in excess of $675,000 within 0.5%. • Provided guidance and assistance to five company grade commanders in their execution of their missions.

title: Company Commander
company: D CO 2-54 IN Fort Benning, GA
description: Chief Executive Officer - Commanded a Basic Entry Training company consisting of 16 Senior Enlisted Drill Sergeants with a primary mission of delivering assessed and trained Soldiers to the United States Army. • Successfully executed eleven rotations of Soldiers through the Army’s Infantry One Station Unit Training program of instruction. • Trained and assessed over 900 new soldiers in basic infantry skills.

title: Battalion S4
description: Senior logistics officer to an Infantry Battalion of over 1000 Soldiers engaged in combat operations in IRAQ. • Coordinated all logistical operations for a battalion consisting of over 250 tactical vehicles, 1000 weapons, 300 radios, 1000 sets of NVGs, and nearly $30M of assigned equipment. • Planned and deployed the battalion to combat from Fort Benning, GA to Diyala Province, IRAQ. • Planned and conducted a 300 kilometer movement of the battalion during combat operations in Iraq ensuring all maintenance, fuel, and ammunition requirements were met and maintained.

title: Company Executive Officer
company: A CO 2-69 AR FT Benning, GA
description: Second in command of a 141 man M2A2 ODS Bradley Fighting Vehicle equipped mechanized infantry company with a world-wide deployment mission in support of the XVIII Airborne Corps. Responsible for coordination, receiving, and allocating of all company level logistics. Supervises company supply non-commissioned officer (NCO), armorer, training room NCO, nuclear biological chemical (NBC) NCO, and communications NCO. Provides command and control of the company in the absence of the commander. Supervises and inspects maintenance of all company equipment. Provides oversight on processing of all company administrative actions and manages the company class IX budget.
name: Ray Windmiller

title: Platoon Leader
description: Responsible for the tactical employment of a Bradley Fighting Vehicle equipped mechanized infantry platoon in the 3rd Infantry Division. Charged with a worldwide rapid-deployment mission as part of the XVIII Airborne Corps. Ensures the platoon is prepared to deploy anywhere in the world by air, land, or sea within 18 hours. Responsible for the accountability, maintenance, and serviceability of four M2A2 Bradley Fighting Vehicles with associated weapons and equipment worth 8 million dollars. Directly responsible for the health, morale, fitness, and training of 38 Soldiers. Ensures a high quality of life for all Soldiers and their families at all times.
